message.content:
We must “build” the net‐fixed asset value by starting with the fixed assets balance that was recorded on 2023‑12‑31 and then adding capitalized acquisitions recorded on the same day (from both the ordinary “Purchase” transactions – which here are heavy equipment “assets” – and any separate “Fixed Assets Purchase” lines) and finally subtracting any depreciation charges recorded later.

Step 1. (Initial Value)

• The “Initial20231231001” entry with type “Fixed Assets” shows an amount of 8,000,000.00.
  → This is our starting (initial) fixed assets “book” value.

Step 2. (Capitalized Acquisitions on 2023‑12‑31)

There are many “Purchase” transactions involving heavy equipment. We assume that—in our data—all these purchases are fixed‐asset additions. Their amounts are as follows:

1. Purchase20231231001: 2,000,000.00  
2. Purchase20231231002: 1,500,000.00  
3. Purchase20231231003: 1,600,000.00  
4. Purchase20231231004: 500,000.00  
5. Purchase20231231005: 1,000,000.00  
6. Purchase20231231006: 1,500,000.00  
7. Purchase20231231007: 1,000,000.00  
8. Purchase20231231008: 1,000,000.00  
9. Purchase20231231009: 1,000,000.00  
10. Purchase20231231010: 800,000.00  
11. Purchase20231231011: 1,600,000.00  
12. Purchase20231231012: 500,000.00  
13. Purchase20231231013: 1,000,000.00  
14. Purchase20231231014: 2,000,000.00  
15. Purchase20231231015: 1,500,000.00  
16. Purchase20231231016: 1,500,000.00  
17. Purchase20231231017: 3,000,000.00  

Let’s add these up:

– Sum of the “Purchase” amounts:
  2,000,000.00  
 + 1,500,000.00 = 3,500,000.00  
 + 1,600,000.00 = 5,100,000.00  
 +   500,000.00 = 5,600,000.00  
 + 1,000,000.00 = 6,600,000.00  
 + 1,500,000.00 = 8,100,000.00  
 + 1,000,000.00 = 9,100,000.00  
 + 1,000,000.00 = 10,100,000.00  
 + 1,000,000.00 = 11,100,000.00  
 +   800,000.00 = 11,900,000.00  
 + 1,600,000.00 = 13,500,000.00  
 +   500,000.00 = 14,000,000.00  
 + 1,000,000.00 = 15,000,000.00  
 + 2,000,000.00 = 17,000,000.00  
 + 1,500,000.00 = 18,500,000.00  
 + 1,500,000.00 = 20,000,000.00  
 + 3,000,000.00 = 23,000,000.00  

In addition there are two “Fixed Assets Purchase” lines:

• FixedAsset20231231001: 1,219,968.64  
• FixedAsset20231231001 (second instance): 1,509,063.62

Add these two:
  1,219,968.64 + 1,509,063.62 = 2,729,032.26

Now add the “Purchase” total and the “Fixed Assets Purchase” total:
  23,000,000.00 + 2,729,032.26 = 25,729,032.26

Step 3. (Total Before Depreciation)

Add initial balance + acquisitions:
  8,000,000.00 + 25,729,032.26 = 33,729,032.26

Step 4. (Deduct Depreciation)

There are two depreciation entries:
• Depreciation20240101001: 45,747.00  
• Depreciation20240201002: 74,884.67

Total depreciation = 45,747.00 + 74,884.67 = 120,631.67

Step 5. (Net Fixed Assets End Value)

Subtract total depreciation from the sum before depreciation:
  33,729,032.26 − 120,631.67 = 33,608,400.59

Step 6. (Formatting Our Answer)

We now have:
• Fixed assets net Initial Value = 8,000,000.00  
• Fixed assets net End Value = 33,608,400.59

Thus our solution in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "fixed assets net Initial Value": "8000000.00", 
    "fixed assets net End Value": "33608400.59"
  }
}
